Package no.ntnu.idatt1001.common

Class ItemRegister

java.lang.Object
no.ntnu.idatt1001.common.ItemRegister
public class ItemRegister extends Object
A class representing a register for instances of the Item class. The register provides basic functionality for modifying a list containing Item objects. The register doesn't allow items with duplicate item numbers, and item numbers are not case-sensitive.
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
10124

  • Constructor Details

    • ItemRegister

      public ItemRegister()
      A constructor for the ItemRegister class. Creates a new instance of an ArrayList for containing Item objects.

  • Method Details

    • addItem

      public void addItem(Item item)
      Adds the specified Item to this register's itemList. A check is performed before the item is added to the list, which checks if list already contains the specified item's item number. If the check returns true, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown, otherwise the item gets added to the list. Since this method is the only way of adding new items, this ensures that every item in the list has a unique item number.
      Parameters:
      item - The Item which should be added to this register's list
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified item's item number already exists in the register's list
      NullPointerException - If the specified item is null

    • searchByItemNumber

      public Item searchByItemNumber(String itemNumberInput)
      Searches the itemList of this instance for the specified item number. Creates a deep-copy of the item that was found, and returns the copy. Only uses one matching item if any matches were found. Utilizes the ItemBuilder.deepCopy(Item) method for deep copying the item.
      Parameters:
      itemNumberInput - Item number which is used to find any matches
      Returns:
      Copy of an Item object if any matches were found,otherwise returns null

    • searchByItemDesc

      public Item searchByItemDesc(String itemDescInput)
      Searches the itemList of this instance for the specified description. Creates a deep-copy of the item that was found, and returns the copy. Only uses one matching item if any matches were found. Utilizes the ItemBuilder.deepCopy(Item) method for deep copying the item.
      Parameters:
      itemDescInput - Item description which is used to find any matches
      Returns:
      Copy of an Item object if any matches were found,otherwise returns null

    • increaseItemStock

      public void increaseItemStock(Item itemInput, int stockIncrease)
      Increases the stock of the specified Item by the specified amount of stock, utilizing the Item.setWarehouseStock(int) method. This method searches the list for the specified item number and adds the specified amount to the existing amount. If the item is not found in this register's list, a NoSuchElementException is thrown. A negative amount is not allowed because that would cause the item stock to decrease. Use the decreaseItemStock(Item, int) method instead.
      Parameters:
      itemInput - The Item which the stock of should be changed
      stockIncrease - The amount of stock that should be added to the specified item's stock. Cannot be below 0
      Throws:
      IllegalNumberException - If the specified amount is below 0
      NoSuchElementException - If the specified item doesn't exist in this register's list
      NullPointerException - If the specified item is null

    • decreaseItemStock

      public void decreaseItemStock(Item itemInput, int stockDecrease)
      Decreases the stock of the specified Item by the specified amount of stock, utilizing the Item.setWarehouseStock(int) method. This method searches the list for the specified item number and subtracts the specified amount from the existing amount. If the item is not found in this register's list, a NoSuchElementException is thrown. A negative amount is not allowed because that would cause the item stock to increase. Use the increaseItemStock(Item, int) method instead.
      Parameters:
      itemInput - The Item which the stock of should be changed
      stockDecrease - The amount of stock that should be subtraced from the specified item's stock. Cannot be below 0
      Throws:
      IllegalNumberException - If the specified amount is below 0
      NoSuchElementException - If the specified item doesn't exist in this register's list
      NullPointerException - If the specified item is null

    • changePriceOfItem

      public void changePriceOfItem(Item itemInput, int price)
      Changes the price of the specified Item to the specified amount, utilizing the Item.setPrice(int) method. This method searches the list for the specified item number and sets the price of the item to the specified amount. If the item is not found in this register's list, a NoSuchElementException is thrown. A negative amount is not allowed.
      Parameters:
      itemInput - The Item which the price of should be changed
      price - The new price which the specified item will have. Cannot be below 0
      Throws:
      IllegalNumberException - If the specified price is below 0
      NoSuchElementException - If the specified item doesn't exist in this register's list
      NullPointerException - If the specified item is null

    • changeDiscountOfItem

      public void changeDiscountOfItem(Item itemInput, double discount)
      Changes the discount of the specified Item to the specified amount, utilizing the Item.setDiscount(double) method. This method searches the list for the specified item number and sets the discount of the item to the specified amount. If the item is not found in this register's list, a NoSuchElementException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      itemInput - The Item which the discount of should be changed.
      discount - The new discount which the specified item will have. Accept numbers between 0 and 100
      Throws:
      IllegalNumberException - If the specified discount is below 0 or above 100
      NoSuchElementException - If the specified item doesn't exist in this register's list
      NullPointerException - If the specified item is null

    • changeDescriptionOfItem

      public void changeDescriptionOfItem(Item itemInput, String description)
      Changes the description of the specified Item to the specified string, utilizing the Item.setDescription(String) method. This method searches the list for the specified item and sets the description of the item to the specified string. If the item is not found in this register's list, a NoSuchElementException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      itemInput - The Item which the description of should be changed
      description - The new description which the specified item will have
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - If the specified item doesn't exist in this register's list
      NullPointerException - If the specified item is null

    • getIndexOfItem

      public int getIndexOfItem(Item itemInput)
      Gets the index of the specified itemNumber in this register's list by utilizing the IntStream class. The stream uses the Stream.filter(Predicate) method to find the item with the specified itemNumber and returns the index.
      Parameters:
      itemInput - The Item which the index of should be returned
      Returns:
      The index number of the specified Item in this register's list, otherwise returns -1 if the item is not found in the list
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the specified item is null

    • removeItem

      public boolean removeItem(Item itemInput)
      Removes the specified Item from this register's list by utilizing the List.remove(Object) method.
      Parameters:
      itemInput - The Item that should be removed from this register's item list
      Returns:
      true if the specified item is in the list, otherwise returns false if the item wasn't found in the list
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the specified item is null

    • sortListByItemnumber

      public void sortListByItemnumber(boolean ascending)
      Sorts this register's list by item number by utilizing the List.sort(Comparator) method. The specified boolean parameter determines if the list should be sorted ascendingly. In this case the list gets sorted alphabetically with the item number
      Parameters:
      ascending - If the specified value is true, the list gets sorted ascendingly, otherwise the list gets sorted descendingly

    • sortListByBrandname

      public void sortListByBrandname(boolean ascending)
      Sorts this register's list by brand name by utilizing the List.sort(Comparator) method. The specified boolean parameter determines if the list should be sorted ascendingly. In this case the list gets sorted alphabetically with the brand name.
      Parameters:
      ascending - If the specified value is true, the list gets sorted ascendingly, otherwise the list gets sorted descendingly

    • sortListByPrice

      public void sortListByPrice(boolean ascending)
      Sorts this register's list by price by utilizing the List.sort(Comparator) method. The specified boolean parameter determines if the list should be sorted ascendingly. In this case the list gets sorted by the number value of the items' price.
      Parameters:
      ascending - If the specified value is true, the list gets sorted ascendingly, otherwise the list gets sorted descendingly

    • sortListByWarehousestock

      public void sortListByWarehousestock(boolean ascending)
      Sorts this register's list by warehouse stock by utilizing the List.sort(Comparator) method. The specified boolean parameter determines if the list should be sorted ascendingly. In this case the list gets sorted by the number value of the items' warehouse stock.
      Parameters:
      ascending - If the specified value is true, the list gets sorted ascendingly, otherwise the list gets sorted descendingly

    • sortListByColor

      public void sortListByColor(boolean ascending)
      Sorts this register's list by Color by utilizing the List.sort(Comparator) method. The specified boolean parameter determines if the list should be sorted ascendingly. In this case the list gets sorted alphabetically with the Color.toString() value.
      Parameters:
      ascending - If the specified value is true, the list gets sorted ascendingly, otherwise the list gets sorted descendingly

    • sortListByCategory

      public void sortListByCategory(boolean ascending)
      Sorts this register's list by Category by utilizing the List.sort(Comparator) method. The specified boolean parameter determines if the list should be sorted ascendingly. In this case the list gets sorted alphabetically with the Category.toString() value.
      Parameters:
      ascending - If the specified value is true, the list gets sorted ascendingly, otherwise the list gets sorted descendingly

    • getCopyOfList

      public List<Item> getCopyOfList()
      Gets a deep-copy of this register's item list by utilizing the ItemBuilder.deepCopy(Item) method. This method creates a stream from the item list, and uses the Stream.map(Function) method to map a deep-copy of every item into a new list which will be returned.
      Returns:
      A List containing a deep-copy of all the items in this register's item list

    • fillListWithDefaultItems

      public void fillListWithDefaultItems()
      Fills this register's item list with pre-made items for testing purposes. This method utilizes the ItemBuilder class for creating Item objects

    • getItem

      public Item getItem(int index)
      Gets a deep-copy of the Item object in the specified index location in this register's list. Utilizes the ItemBuilder.deepCopy(Item) method for deep copying the item.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the item which should be deep-copied and retrieved. Cannot be below 0 or greater than size() - 1
      Returns:
      A deep-copy of the Item in the specified index location
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified index is below 0 or greater than this register's list

    • size

      public int size()
      Gets the size of this register's item list by utilizing the List.size() method.
      Returns:
      The size of this register's list

    • toString

      public String toString()
      A standard to-string method with all the relevant information from this item register in a specific format. Displays all the items in itemList.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string formatted with all the relevant information about this item register
